The Western War Works.

"The lack of proper means that is usually brought upon working men by the failure to provide them with sufficient food, clothing, shelter, and medical care, is a constant source of worry and concern. It is difficult to imagine how much more difficult it would be without these basic necessities. The women who have been forced to work in these conditions have faced many challenges, but they have also found ways to overcome them. Their resilience and determination have inspired others to stand up for their rights and demand better working conditions."

The Poor Road.

"To help improve the lives of those who are struggling, it is important to provide them with access to resources that will enable them to improve their living conditions. This can include access to education, healthcare, and employment opportunities. By providing these resources, we can help ensure that everyone has the opportunity to live a better life."

Unlikely Alliance.

"Even though there are differences between the French and English speaking communities, there is still an opportunity for cooperation and understanding. By working together, we can create a stronger society that is more resilient and better able to address the challenges we face."

OUR REPRESENTATIVES.

"It is important for us to be aware of the representatives who are elected to represent our interests. By staying informed about the issues that affect us, we can ensure that our voices are heard and that our needs are met."

Rapid City Ripples.

—25th before noon on Monday morning at eight o'clock.

—We received the particulars of the magistrate's court Monday too late for this issue, but will appear next week.

—Councillor Head is now perambulating the Counties of Wellington and York and other districts in the North West. So far he has visited the several hundreds of towns and villages, and if successful will replace them amongst farmers and others.

—Mr. Stone has arrived from his farm near Fort Elizab, stated his intention of returning to Rapid City if the tide of events so moved him; there is little doubt of its coming as the various documents coming in frequently shows us to believe.

Public Notice.

LEGISLATURE OF MANITOBA.

BILLS RELATING TO SERVICES ON PARLIAMENT DAYS.

48. No public funds for Finance Bill introduced by the House into the first four days of the session.

All applications for Finance Bills, or any other Bills which are expected to be introduced during the session, should be made to the Secretary of the Legislative Assembly of Manitoba, in accordance with the provisions of Section 13 of the Act, 1876, which for the purposes of a longer period of time, shall be deemed to be in force until the date of the next session. Any such application must be made at least one day in advance of the date on which the Bill is to be introduced.

His House—Mr. Land did not return to resign.

Mr. Jackson said that he prepared an answer to prove he did resign. He referred to the attempt of Mr. Dewdney to prevent the publication of his (Mr. Jackson's) statement in the (Governor's) speech, and inserted an extract from Mr. Dewdney's letter to Mr. Land about the death Indians five of them died of starvation. The Indians were not able to maintain life and were forced to give up their lives by the Indian Agents.

His Honor—False! False! False!
